website_summaries.verdict: Designed for children in grades 3 through 5, this big-kid gear set comes with lesson plans for 7 fully-functioning, real-world gear models.
pros: Can build 7 fully- functioning gear models of simple machines
Comes with a thorough teacher's guide and experiment guides that can help show science concepts in action
Science guides are aligned to national standards
cons: Pieces may be difficult to snap together at first, but loosen over time

customer_reviews.title: PROs and CONs
customer_reviews.text: Mixed review. A great deal of assembly to demonstrate each simple machine. If you want a fun kit to assemble it's great. If you just want to just demonstrate simple machines, the kit requires too much work. My 7 year old could easily follow the color coded parts. His finger got tired snapping in the many pieces. The smaller pieces were difficult to disconnect. I had difficulty "playing" the enclosed Teacher's Guide DVD. It's actually a digital text that would only load on one of my several devices.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: This kit has a fun variety of projects, all with satisfyingly realistic results. And for once an "educational" toy actually had clear educational value, prompting the kids to make a change in the project and then observe the difference and draw a conclusion. (I really should get out the CD-ROM that came with this and see what additional gems it has!) My 5yo was able to complete the projects with minimal help (just in figuring out how to join completed portions together), while my 7yo could follow the directions completely independently. The two-speed fan is a definite favorite in this house!
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Food for the growing mind
customer_reviews.text: These do for a modern youngster what Tinker Toys did for my generation. They provide entertainment and a feel for physics and design and an opportunity to exercise both imagination and patience to see a project through. They provide opportunity to develop manual dexterity. Pride of accomplishment and confidence also comes with a box of K'nex parts. Instructions actually work. Everyone ought to know when to follow them and that lesson is inside the box too When enough of these little plastic parts lie in a pile, the young imagination is set loose among the resources that can make the imagined thing become real. Get your children some of these and throw out the video games.
customer_reviews.author: John HenryTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great for science class
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my classroom. They are easy to assemble and disassemble. The only down side to this specific kit is that there are only enough pieces to make one project at a time.
customer_reviews.author: BPinNY

customer_reviews.title: Mind food
customer_reviews.text: These do for a modern youngster what Tinker Toys did for my generation. They provide entertainment and a feel for physics and design and an opportunity to exercise both imagination and patience to see a project through. They provide opportunity to develop manual dexterity. Pride of accomplishment and confidence also comes with a box of K'nex parts. Instructions actually work. Everyone ought to know when to follow them and that lesson is inside the box too When enough of these little plastic parts lie in a pile, the young imagination is set loose among the resources that can make the imagined thing become real. Get your children some of these and throw out the video games.
customer_reviews.author: John HenryTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and awesome!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing and challenging engineering toy! My five-year-old and her dad built the crank fan, which uses gears, in just a couple of hours. The pieces are easy to snap together, and the instructions don't dumb anything down -- you really have to work your spatial reasoning skills and examine the diagrams to assemble the machines in stages. Of course, we are that homeschooling family that throws away the Lego set instructions... so if you want explicit and simple written (as opposed to visual) instructions, Knex might be get little frustrating. For us, they're a wonderful challenge!
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Gray connectors warped
customer_reviews.text: This was great until all the gray pieces' middle sections warped apart enough to not hold other pieces anymore, so basically nothing in the booklet can be constructed anymore. And we have only done K'Nex projects every other week or so -- it's not like we've been using them strenuously or anything. My kids and I are pretty disappointed that most of the play value is gone due to those gray connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug Lyn

customer_reviews.title: This is very fun, a little too difficult for my 7 year ...
customer_reviews.text: This is very fun, a little too difficult for my 7 year old to build without help though as some pieces are difficult to snap together. I wish there were more pieces so that I could build several of the machines at the time. In conjunction with other K'NEX sets that I had though, I could build three at a time. My two boys (ages 7 and 5) especially like the egg beater.
customer_reviews.author: Paula L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome set. Perfect for the little engineers in the making! Have fun, learn as you do! So many things you can do with this set,
customer_reviews.author: kapu

customer_reviews.title: Get Thrill Rides instead
customer_reviews.text: I bought K'NEX Thrill Rides – 3-in-1 Classic Amusement Park Building Set – 744 Pieces – Ages 7+ Engineering Education Toy at about the same time as this set. Thrill Rides is a much better, much more interesting set with many more pieces (744 vs. 198). Now even the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Great set for young learners
customer_reviews.text: My boys got this set for Christmas and we love it! They're only 5 but it's never too young to start learning about simple machines. We've been able to explain all kinds of neat concepts and they love to build the projects!
customer_reviews.author: Collin M. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Good kit
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with 7 to 10 year old students who have enjoyed it. They have been able to figure out how to build the machines with minimal help. The container is nice--you can see all of the pieces and sort through them easily to find the one you want. The lid snaps on and holds tight so pieces stay inside while stored.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning toy
customer_reviews.text: As a homeschooling family, my son goes through building toys quickly. I loved that this one set had multiple instructions and allowed for several building options. He set up each one, built it, played with it, and then tore it down a few days later to build the next. The photos gave clear images to direct him and I especially like that all the pieces needed are included. No need to hunt for other pieces! The CD learning guide is packed with good lessons about the science and math behind the machines. We will definitely use this again, diving in deeper using the computer printables.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Stranathan

customer_reviews.title: What a great way to teach simple machines to my science students!
customer_reviews.text: I teach Conceptual Physics to 10th graders, and try to use as many hands-on activities as possible, thinking that they may at least remember the activity, even if they forget Newton's Laws. K'NEX will be great in this environment. This specialized kit has great teacher resources as well. My only problem is that one kit is enough for one group, so I'll have to purchase more kits. This looks like a really great way to teach students about the different ways gears work.
customer_reviews.author: B. Yelverton

customer_reviews.title: K'Nex is always a great choice
customer_reviews.text: You can;t go wrong with K'Nex...they stimulate the brain and good for hand - eye coordination. My son became structural engineer---he used to take these things apart and redesign them into something else. Good way to heighten a child's interest ---it is an active engagement toy, not passive like electronic gizmos, of which many children already have plenty
customer_reviews.author: texellence

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, nicely packaged for my future engineer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought for a Christmas present for my grandson who is a very curious-minded and capable almost-10 year old. It looks like an awesome set and is boxed in a nice plastic container. I am hoping he is excited about it and has a fun learning experience with it. He is interested this days about learning about gears, so this hits the spot for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: TK Sweet

customer_reviews.title: no noise and it falls apart easily once you get something built
customer_reviews.text: The set was missing a small, important part, right out of the box. It is a crucial part of the main gear. The 6 yr old doesn't have much interest in this. There are no lights, no noise and it falls apart easily once you get something built. So part of the problem is the child's likes and dislikes. He is really great at math and this seems a little too easy for him.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Great variety of machines to make
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of machines to make. My sons have really enjoyed playing with this over and over again. My main complaint is the instruction book. I laminated it because it was starting to get torn and fall apart. Once the instructions are gone, I feel the kit isn't as fun. Pieces are a little hard for my 5 year old, but not for my 9 year old. They both like to build them together though. Great gift that I like as a parent too.
customer_reviews.author: Orvin C. Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my son's school stuff! He loves building and finding new ways to create!
customer_reviews.author: Bolich

customer_reviews.title: Gears gets them going
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7 year old and he loves playing with it. He is always making-up his own gears out of Knex and Lego pieces, so I though that this would go well with him. It is a simple set and young kids should be able to play with minimal help. The hardest part of the set is snapping some parts together as little fingers may not always be able to do it. Overall a nice buy and I've never seem the education sets at the stores.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with K'Nex!
customer_reviews.text: My now young adult sons LOVED K'Nex so got this set for a young relative. Before we could return back to our home a few hours away, I got a tex that he had dived into the set and thoroughly enjoyed building each of the challenges. Can't go wrong with K'Nex and I recommend their other simple machine sets, too! Just make sure kids pick them up as you don't want to step on some of the pieces during the night :)
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't received with great joy, but I built the first one with ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 7 year old daughter for Christmas. I wasn't received with great joy, but I built the first one with her 9 year old brother and she started to take interest. Why? Because they are competitive. By build number 3 she was all in and now is so proud of her ability. I'm here on Amazon to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for any K'nex set for an elementary aged kid and this one is really great! I was impressed with how well the simple machines worked. K'nex sets seem to need to be "broken in" so a younger child will need help at first getting some of the pieces together. I've noticed it gets easier with time. I love the most that this comes with it's own storage box. There is a cdrom or dvd or something that came with it, but we haven't checked that out yet.
customer_reviews.author: H. Macy

customer_reviews.title: Great Hands-On Science/Engineering Kit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit, bought it especially for an afternoon when my daughter had a few friends over, and they were fully absorbed by this activity- experimenting, learning and having a lot of fun at the same time. They came up with a couple of their own designs, too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CallieSD

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. The pieces were good. My 8 year old daughter can handle it on her own. I just wish the instruction manual or the book that came along was more kid friendly with better explanations.
customer_reviews.author: Regency

customer_reviews.title: Perfect building set!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves this product. He first built two of the designs. Then he tore them apart and created his own structure. So far it has kept him busy and not interested in the TV. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: My boys looooooove these K'Nex!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough great things about these K'Nex... great building toys - and it's hard to call them toys when they're so creative in so many ways - my boys will spend hours building, creating, redesigning and building some more with these, I'm glad I got them several different sets so they have endless options.
customer_reviews.author: MotoBella

customer_reviews.title: THIS WAS A GIFT
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS A GIFT to a great great nephew, whom I'm told enjoyed it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer RJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: My daughter immediately opened the box and got to work. She made all the examples. She just wished she didn't have to undo to begin another.
customer_reviews.author: DEwing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Young Bright Minds
customer_reviews.text: A very bright 7 year-old was thrilled with this kit to construct simple machines - the quality is very good and the instructions easy for a young boy to follow - as well as his grammy. My grandson loves to invent new ways of putting ideas to work and this kit fits that bill.
customer_reviews.author: ruditooty

customer_reviews.title: My son loves K'Nex and we started to buy the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves K'Nex and we started to buy the older sets for him even though he is only eight. This set can work for kids as young as 6 if you sit with them through the first few projects.
customer_reviews.author: normal guy

customer_reviews.title: My son loves K'Nex and we started to buy the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves K'Nex and we started to buy the older sets for him even though he is only eight. This set can work for kids as young as 6 if you sit with them through the first few projects.
customer_reviews.author: normal guy

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my daughter to see if she enjoyed them and it was a success. Simple but satisfying set to get your kids learning basic mechanics.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son has learned and had fun with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Camren N.

customer_reviews.title: Adds excitement and fun to learning
customer_reviews.text: The K'Nex educational series has many of the same assembly characteristics as Legos. But it demonstrates some basic principles of how things operate that Legos do not. I've not seen my 9 year old grandson receive a Christmas present with more enthusiasm than this. I have bought two others in the series (wheels & axels, and levers & pulleys) and highly recommend them all.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Cover

customer_reviews.title: Fun for older kids who are intrigued by how things work
customer_reviews.text: My 6th grade daughter really enjoyed building with this and learning about simple machines. She did not need a lot of instructions to get started, as she loves working with her hands and figuring things out.
customer_reviews.author: Delana H. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Legos be gone
customer_reviews.text: My son gets so annoyed with legos but loves to create. Glad to have discovered k'nex for him. He will actually spend time building things, ON HIS OWN. And not need guided play.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: since this was a gift for a great grandchild I should say he loved it
customer_reviews.text: Well, since this was a gift for a great grandchild I should say he loved it. He sent me pictures of things he had made with this very clever toy. Almost wish I had a set!
customer_reviews.author: Marylou Ocheltree

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set and my son has learned a lot from ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set and my son has learned a lot from it. The only downside is that there are a few tricky spots that had trouble clicking together, and then a few pieces that broke when getting them apart. Replacement parts are available, but the shipping is more then the pieces themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Disneymom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my son's school stuff! He loves building and finding new ways to create!
customer_reviews.author: Bolich

customer_reviews.title: Good for Prototypes for Inventions
customer_reviews.text: This helped me build a prototype for an invention of mines.
customer_reviews.author: komarco

customer_reviews.title: The price should be less for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive for what you get. You can’t make more than one project at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Great learning tool for my child who has trouble using both hands due to stroke in womb she has fun learning to use both hands
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like lego directions
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat set. The directions aren't the easiest to follow, even for an adult. Nothing like lego directions!
customer_reviews.author: BusyMom83

customer_reviews.title: My kids love k'nex. The directions are a little over their ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love k'nex. The directions are a little over their heads, they are 4 and 5, but with Da's help they can build the pulleys and things. They just love to build all sorts if things with these pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: My son loves K'Nex and we started to buy the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves K'Nex and we started to buy the older sets for him even though he is only eight. This set can work for kids as young as 6 if you sit with them through the first few projects.
customer_reviews.author: normal guy

customer_reviews.title: I don't know yet if the recipient liked it, I did like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift, but it's really the gift I'd wanted to have when I was a kid - a long time ago... I don't know yet if the recipient liked it, I did like it. It seems to me much more entertaining than Lego. (I know that I expose myself to the wrath of the cult...)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for science class
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my classroom. They are easy to assemble and disassemble. The only down side to this specific kit is that there are only enough pieces to make one project at a time
customer_reviews.author: BPinNY

customer_reviews.title: Adds excitement and fun while  learning
customer_reviews.text: The K'Nex educational series has many of the same assembly characteristics as Legos. But it demonstrates some basic principles of how things operate that Legos do not. . I've not seen my 10 year old grandson receive a Christmas present with more enthusiasm than this. I have bought two others in the series (wheels & axels, and Gears) and highly recommend them all.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Cover

customer_reviews.title: Good toy.
customer_reviews.text: My eight year old grandson has enjoyed this set, though he likes to do his own thing and modifies the instructions. It keeps him busy for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Linda E.

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating
customer_reviews.text: The grandchildren fought over it so taking turns had to be enforced.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, esp if they love LEGOs
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an awesome educational toy. Fine motor skills, physics lessons and most likely they need help, so its great for playing well with others or following directions. My 7yo gets all this while he plays! Very happy! I just wish this was cheaper in price.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Jane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my son's school stuff! He loves building and finding new ways to create!
customer_reviews.author: Bolich

customer_reviews.title: Good for Prototypes for Inventions
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me build a prototype for an invention of mines.
customer_reviews.author: komarco

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Parts a little tight at times
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product (the entire series). The parts are a little tight for little hands though. I have to help remove or insert them. I'm sure this problem with disappear as the child grows, but it is worth noting
customer_reviews.author: A Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy and Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was never a big fan of toys (preferred everyday items or outdoor play) but this toy was a hit. She started playing with it around 8 and still pulls it out once in awhile and she is almost 11.
customer_reviews.author: Visionary63

customer_reviews.title: STEM Class
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my inclusion and SPED kids in STEM class.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: STEM Class
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my inclusion and SPED kids in STEM class.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Even I enjoy this as an adult
customer_reviews.text: Even I enjoy this as an adult. My kid loves this and the best thing about it is that it bring out the creativity in the child.
customer_reviews.author: Bhilam

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My eight year old granddaughter enjoys building these machines and they are educational. We previously bought the "Gears" kit and both kits are good.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Tom

customer_reviews.title: but a very fun and interesting toy nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive and I wish they'd include more sets with each box for this price, but a very fun and interesting toy nonetheless, which I can see growing with our young sons through their teenage years.You have to build exactly what they tell you to build in the instructions so there's not a lot of room for thinking "outside the box" like with a Lego set, however. I guess I wish we had purchased a massive K'Nex piece set so we could be more creative with the pieces - but I understand the concept of the sets is to teach a specific physics topic. For that purpose, this set is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The building possibilities are endless and fun, sneaking some education in on the side!
customer_reviews.author: mulutn5

customer_reviews.title: Mind food
customer_reviews.text: These do for a modern youngster what Tinker Toys did for my generation. They provide entertainment and a feel for physics and design and an opportunity to exercise both imagination and patience to see a project through. They provide opportunity to develop manual dexterity. Pride of accomplishment and confidence also comes with a box of K'nex parts. Instructions actually work. Everyone ought to know when to follow them and that lesson is inside the box too When enough of these little plastic parts lie in a pile, the young imagination is set loose among the resources that can make the imagined thing become real. Get your children some of these and throw out the video games.
customer_reviews.author: John HenryTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: My kids have really enjoyed putting the K'NEX projects together in this kit
customer_reviews.text: My kids have really enjoyed putting the K'NEX projects together in this kit. I am very pleased with the directions provided and the results. I am looking forward to working with the bridges kit next.
customer_reviews.author: mratatat

customer_reviews.title: K'nex was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: The high reviews were right. My 11 YO grandson thanked me a dozen times, and says he likes it much more than Legos. This is his first K'nex set. Wish I had discovered it sooner! He was able to figure out all the instructions himself. I think the fact that he was working from illustrations rather than a lot of written directions helped. The 13 YO got interested so I bought two more sets. I think it's a fun, challenging toy for the 8 - 13.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good intro to simple physics concepts
customer_reviews.text: My 9 and 10 year old boys enjoyed putting together some of the various machines in this set. I was able to use this as a supplement to our homeschool unit on simple machines. It helped the kids to be able to visualize the concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Linus Maiden

customer_reviews.title: Well received and both are liked by the boys
customer_reviews.text: Gave 2 for presents. Well received and both are liked by the boys.
customer_reviews.author: leon rabidou

customer_reviews.title: Great to add to your collection.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 year old daughter. She loves legos. This was the first time we tried k'nex and this is a great piece to add to your collection. It kept her busy for a good 1.5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: My grandson started building the machines the minute I gave it to him. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: MercK

customer_reviews.title: These are great! I have a number of them and use ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I have a number of them and use them with homeschoolers. There is a difference between the little kits and the larger ones. The little kits have about 2-3 experiments for each topic to the larger kits 5-7 per topic. Either way though, they are great. The individual kits are definitely enough for one kid and teach the same lessons, but if you have a kids that wants to build more or you have more than one student, the larger kits are great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tweeners
customer_reviews.text: Comes with DVD. Works with other sets. Boxes stack for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur G.B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Even though the parts lock together, when you try ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though the parts lock together, when you try to operate the machine there is too much slack and the parts don't stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids who like to build stuff
customer_reviews.text: Having moving parts makes this kit a lot more fun than others. Some of the drawing are not super-clear and 9yo needed a little help with them, but was able to use it mostly by herself.
customer_reviews.author: Alwaysbusy

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved it. Excellent challenging toy for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational toy
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love this kit. I teach general science, and my 9th grades enjoyed making each of the 6 simple machines as our final activity to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year old grandson loves to play with these
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old grandson loves to play with these K'NEX parts. I need to sit with him to help build the toys outlined in the manual, but he still enjoys creating and experimenting with the pieces on his own.
customer_reviews.author: DIYGuy

customer_reviews.title: Creative toy
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is so creative. He has designed so many things with the Knex.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Hellenbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Great for science class
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my classroom. They are easy to assemble and disassemble. The only down side to this specific kit is that there are only enough pieces to make one project at a time
customer_reviews.author: BPinNY

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and fun
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old grandson is a Lego fan and I wanted him to branch out and I gave him a K'nex set last year and he loved it. This was also a big hit. I love to give him educational challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Katarden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nephew loves it and stays busy making all sorts of projects!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Great building fun!
customer_reviews.text: K'Nex Gears was bought for my six-year-old grandson for Christmas. He enjoys building cars with it and, five months later, is still enjoying playing. Some of the machines are still too sophisticated for him to build, but he's careful to put all the parts away in the box each time he gets it out. This toy will last and keep his interest for several more years: I plan to add additional sets to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little overpriced for the amount
customer_reviews.text: There is too little for the amount of knex you get, but it is remedied by the different creation variations you can construct.
customer_reviews.author: Jhovany

customer_reviews.title: and he gets a lot of use and fun out of these
customer_reviews.text: I've got a grandson who loves K'nex, and he gets a lot of use and fun out of these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves this toy. He has always liked seeing how things work. He might get a little tired of it now that he has made all of the projects in the book, but I am thinking he will just try to invent his own projects now.
customer_reviews.author: 6littleones

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: We have spent lots of time playing with this! It keeps my son's attention and the pieces go together easy and stay together sturdy. Lots of fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wants to be an engineer and these fit the bill. She will sit in her room for hours, follow the directions and then proudly display her creation. She has kept them together and has them displayed on her desk! Great for eye-hand coordination, direction following and comprehension!
customer_reviews.author: Ainsley's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good design and fastening method
customer_reviews.text: Snaps together in different configurations quite well. The distinct coloring used to differentiate the size and function of pieces is quite helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kingtut645

customer_reviews.title: A+ seller
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my nephew he really enjoys building this. Great seller great product
customer_reviews.author: Osbaldo

customer_reviews.title: Fun to put together
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had so much fun putting these together. I love that she gets a lesson on machines while being able to play at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: A.Ferman

customer_reviews.title: k'nex rule
customer_reviews.text: my son (7) has loved this set of k'nex. he built every one of the items it shows you how to build in the included booklet. they all worked. it was challenging, but he looked so satisfied and proud when he finished. a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: mamaknowsbest

customer_reviews.title: Laura really enjoyed seeing how the gears of each finished project actually ...
customer_reviews.text: Into to Simple Machines: Gears was a success with my 10 yr old niece. She needed a little help from her dad to get the idea of how pieces fit together (like nothing she'd done before), but after that, the instructions were clear and she was off and running. Laura really enjoyed seeing how the gears of each finished project actually moved. The blender and exercise bike were big hits. A well-designed hands-on toy for girls who've outgrown playing with dolls.
customer_reviews.author: Reita Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Built a simple limited slip differential using only what was ...
customer_reviews.text: Built a simple limited slip differential using only what was provided in the kit. If only it included more gears! My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: Kids of all ages love these things
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandchildren. They loved them. But, my son not so much, they are addictive and pricy. My grandchildren now have a chest full. Sorry parent!!
customer_reviews.author: AQC Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Fun set
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves these and prefers them over legos.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalezfamily

customer_reviews.title: He was pleased with every creation
customer_reviews.text: Played with right under the Christmas Tree. Kept my 10 year old grandson busy for hours. Used his reading/assembly skills. He was pleased with every creation. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: MOM OF MUSIC NUT

customer_reviews.title: I felt in love with Knex Education goods
customer_reviews.text: I felt in love with Knex Education goods. It's so cool to play with my kids while teaching them science. Futher, kids setup it easily, play and learn through doing.
customer_reviews.author: F. B. Cisneiros

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My four year old grandson loved them and that is what really matters, right? A child will need supervision as the printed directions may be difficult to understand..
customer_reviews.author: exan

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for a 9 year old boy who really seemed to like it.
customer_reviews.author: S L Vinc

customer_reviews.title: Quality and design
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Excellent design. I am impressed with K'nex determination to be useful toy as well as educational.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Zm

customer_reviews.title: very good to teach kids simple machines
customer_reviews.text: very good to teach kids simple machines. i would not go by the age here.. you can introduce this to 6-7 year old as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shakuntala Nitturkar
